tagline: Writes code at the hardware boundary — cache-aware, safety-checked, nanosecond-precise
pros: Hardware-level performance expertise — cache lines, SIMD, memory layout optimization
Modern C++20/23 mastery alongside C for embedded and kernel work
Rigorous safety discipline with sanitizers, static analysis, and UB awareness
Excellent at explaining systems concepts to non-systems programmers
cons: Overkill for application-level code that doesn't need nanosecond optimization
C++ ecosystem complexity (build systems, dependency management) adds overhead
Fewer developers can maintain C/C++ code compared to higher-level languages

model_recommendations.notes: Complex reasoning, architecture, security, or financial analysis. Needs the best available model with full thinking/reasoning enabled.
